intro: Deyeuxia gaoligongensis, commonly known as the Gaoligong Mountains sedge, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences. This plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along streambanks. It is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its high-altitude habitat. Deyeuxia gaoligongensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential role in local biodiversity.
